Articles.Content:
You're board, interesting are you cardboard as well? Try doing a bit of both! Build a space shuttle and put missiles on it and blow up stuff!

Na but what would be fun is to recreate the Loki space station battle from CoD: Ghost

OHHH HATBAT: I GOT TO PM YOU!!!!!!

Man, is anyone up for a joint venture to build the Inquisitor? like you know, help me? I am certain that I can repair the design but it will take time so I thought I would offer plus you get to actually see it early

Man, is anyone up for a joint venture to build the Inquisitor? like you know, help me? I am certain that I can repair the design but it will take time so I thought I would offer plus you get to actually see it early

How many parts is it so far and what mods?
SP+, something like 164, I will try to finish tomorrow, if not, then well, we can make it together

So in my boredom I decided to take a page out of the old Soviet Union playbook

Here are my results

Amazingly I got it pretty much right on the first try. Gota love it when KSP decides to play nice with you and make what should be a hard project and nail it on the first go round.

More pics will come tomorrow.

I'm just wondering: if I were to one day continue my DayZ series would you guys watch it? I recently went back and had a look at some of the more entertaining episodes and I have to say I'm proud of how I made that series, so much so that it would be a lot of fun to start it up again. They wouldn't take much time away from the Kethane Station; recording usually took a day and then editing took two. It might also be fun to invite all my subscribers to come and play DayZ with me for an evening and record it as some sort of ProCraftia army. So what do you guys think? I understand that about 90% of my audience care for nothing other than KSP when it comes to my channel, but I still think they might find this interesting as the way I create DayZ videos is in a very similar style and quality to the Kethane Station (just without all the time).

Edited September 23, 2014 by HatBat

SP+, something like 164, I will try to finish tomorrow, if not, then well, we can make it together

164? That's quite low for an orbital combat ship, Victory is built with over 400. Most coming from the ship's weapons.

I'd watch it, but I wouldn't be able to join in for two reasons:

1. I don't own DayZ yet.

2. My PC's a potato, which needs attentive care to run any game that's highly RAM/graphics/CPU-intensive.

Added another one to the company list.

I should probably take a break

So what's everbodys plan today?

For me it's go to class and work on a project due Thursday for HBSE II

If I got time I ll show off my newest space shuttle some more
I'm planing a 2:30 release of 3 new ships.

I had a go with the new camera mod with this one, tell me what you think.

Wow I'm big on the credits indeed. Thanks! Great episode BTW, your flying is much improved . Quick question tough, have you tried switching control to the upwards-facing docking port on the miner? I think I put one on top for that, or a probe or something. Helps with nulling out horizontal velocity on the terminal descent, and you can switch back the the other point of view by pressing "C" twice very quickly. That way you'll have less derps due to the cheaty construction.

But other than that, yeah, great one going back to the basics, but with a new level of quality. I hope you get rid of all bugs really quickly!

Rune. Good job!

This episode looked absolutely gorgeous. I'm really glad to have helped create the Albion and Helios (SX-8 Mako), and I look forward to further adventures!

<p><strong>felipe (harvester)

<p><span>i must warn however, that several sp+ parts do replace old parts, and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s very likely that some spaceplane designs can become weird or misaligned. This wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t actually break saves, but ships featuring those old parts wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t look their best until rebuilt in the editor. For most cases, simply detaching and reattaching the misplaced parts will do. We decided it was for the best to simply bite the bullet on this one, because there is no point in having old parts linger around, wasting our already cramped memory space, just for the sake of delaying this inevitable change. </span></p>

<p><span>if you want to start preparing your saves for the release, i recommend recovering all ongoing spaceplane missions. The parts that have been most changed are the c7 delta wing and triangular wing sections, standard and small control surfaces, and minor changes were done to the mk1 fuselages and cockpit, and the entire mk2 set. I know itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a bit of a hassle to have to do this, but trust me when i say itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be well worth it!</span><strong><strong><br/></strong></strong></p>
